definition: lit. the solicitude of the crow (who provides for his old parent)(idiom)/fig. filial piety
the play of passions/carried away by passion (e.g. to commit a crime)

sentences.english: She disclosed her kiss-and-tell story with a pop-star to the press.
sentences.chinese: 她向報界透露她自己跟某天王歌星的私情。

sentences.english: Human righteousness, but in the righteous cause of the front, to put aside personal affair.
sentences.chinese: 爲人仁義，但在大義面前，能夠放下個人私情。

sentences.english: Gifts to the staff of leadership is to deepen Siqing.
sentences.chinese: 職員給領導送禮是爲深化私情。

sentences.english: You see, command allows no intimacies.
sentences.chinese: 你知道嗎，命令不允許有任何私情。

sentences.english: However, the girl fell in love with the boy next door, the two had an affair.
sentences.chinese: 可是，姑娘卻愛上鄰家的少年，兩人有了私情。

definition: to have secret ties with/to be in covert communication with (the enemy etc)/to engage in an illicit sexual relationship/adultery
to conspire to murder/to plot against sb's life
to carry on a clandestine love affair
to have an affair with sb
to entrap/to set up/to frame (up)/to make false charges against
to rival sb for the affection of a man or woman/to be jealous of a rival in a love affair
